Transcription for 548078

The Seven of the Wind
The seven of the wind, here on earth,
I can't even see going far,
For to rightly know, rightly know,
My worth ever being worth in part.
Thus my little dove, with him oying,
Coming down out of stormy green,
I told of thine, nor I missed,
For I'll settle and carry your weight.
This of all the seven you have left,
I cry, my little dove, redeem,
And some honor of bearing,
I've garnered above all of clear.
My seven o' lead and his sky roll,
I tell me I'm so beautiful, me.
I cry to you, dearly, a seven,
A seven new yessing I hear,
A seven new yessing I hear.
